attributes.additional_details:
We, the undersigned have lost confidence in the Government to effectively deal with the problems the country currently faces.

Failiure to stimulate job creation, selling off of contracts to overseas companies, failiure to reduce pressure on businesses and failiure force banks to lend money to businesses to stimulate growth, initiating rocketing taxes which are penalising the most vulnerable people, selling off the NHS (against the advice of all the major Colleges), initiating cuts in the military and Police force that will make the UK vulnerable from a security standpoint. The government actions are in effect harming the recovery of the country, increasing unemployment to higher levels and going against the best interests of the consituents they were voted in to serve.

We demand the opportunity to file a vote of non-confidence against the coalition government.

rejection.details: Votes of no confidence are a matter for Parliament and not the Government.
